content: "http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0309/19517.html" quote: Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Steele says he has reached out to Rush Limbaugh to tell him he meant no offense when he referred to the popular conservative radio host as an “entertainer” whose show can be “incendiary.” “My intent was not to go after Rush – I have enormous respect for Rush Limbaugh,” Steele said in a telephone interview. “I was maybe a little bit inarticulate. … There was no attempt on my part to diminish his voice or his leadership.” DADDY Limbaugh took Steele behind the wood shed and spank that "man" silly: DONT (Whack) you ever (Whack) Talk back to me (Whack) again (WHACK!) If you're a Republican dont EVER talk back to Daddy!
quote: Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Steele says he has reached out to Rush Limbaugh to tell him he meant no offense when he referred to the popular conservative radio host as an “entertainer” whose show can be “incendiary.” “My intent was not to go after Rush – I have enormous respect for Rush Limbaugh,” Steele said in a telephone interview. “I was maybe a little bit inarticulate. … There was no attempt on my part to diminish his voice or his leadership.”
reply: "http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0309/19517.html"  DADDY Limbaugh took Steele behind the wood shed and spank that "man" silly: DONT (Whack) you ever (Whack) Talk back to me (Whack) again (WHACK!) If you're a Republican dont EVER talk back to Daddy!
title: Steele to Rush: I'm sorry

content: quote: Originally posted by spanner69: "http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0309/19517.html" quote: Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Steele says he has reached out to Rush Limbaugh to tell him he meant no offense when he referred to the popular conservative radio host as an “entertainer” whose show can be “incendiary.” “My intent was not to go after Rush – I have enormous respect for Rush Limbaugh,” Steele said in a telephone interview. “I was maybe a little bit inarticulate. … There was no attempt on my part to diminish his voice or his leadership.” DADDY Limbaugh took Steele behind the wood shed and spank that "man" silly: DONT (Whack) you ever (Whack) Talk back to me (Whack) again (WHACK!) If you're a Republican dont EVER talk back to Daddy! LMAO I knew it would happen. As I said before, if a guy like Limbaugh is the leader of the GOP, that party is in serious, serious trouble. We all view polls selectively, but the latest poll from Time has his popularity nationwide at about 29 percent ("http://www.timepolls.com/hppolls/archive/poll_results_281.html"). That isn't a good thing... What many people forget is that Limbaugh, like Fox News, enjoys a small lion's share of support. When I say, "small lion's share", what I mean is that they might have the largest single number among a host of competitors/ contemporaries. When you look more closely at those numbers, however, you'll find that, among a certain demographic, Fox and Limbaugh have no competition, and that explains their "success".
quote: Originally posted by spanner69: "http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0309/19517.html" quote: Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Steele says he has reached out to Rush Limbaugh to tell him he meant no offense when he referred to the popular conservative radio host as an “entertainer” whose show can be “incendiary.” “My intent was not to go after Rush – I have enormous respect for Rush Limbaugh,” Steele said in a telephone interview. “I was maybe a little bit inarticulate. … There was no attempt on my part to diminish his voice or his leadership.” DADDY Limbaugh took Steele behind the wood shed and spank that "man" silly: DONT (Whack) you ever (Whack) Talk back to me (Whack) again (WHACK!) If you're a Republican dont EVER talk back to Daddy!
reply: LMAO I knew it would happen. As I said before, if a guy like Limbaugh is the leader of the GOP, that party is in serious, serious trouble. We all view polls selectively, but the latest poll from Time has his popularity nationwide at about 29 percent ("http://www.timepolls.com/hppolls/archive/poll_results_281.html"). That isn't a good thing... What many people forget is that Limbaugh, like Fox News, enjoys a small lion's share of support. When I say, "small lion's share", what I mean is that they might have the largest single number among a host of competitors/ contemporaries. When you look more closely at those numbers, however, you'll find that, among a certain demographic, Fox and Limbaugh have no competition, and that explains their "success".
title: Steele to Rush: I'm sorry

If the conservative is good for the country, then we Dem's shouldn't have any problem with it. But the problem is, most moderate/conservative's are either Democrats or Independents, or Democrat voters. The conservatives you are referring to are right winger radicals like Rush. So long as Rush is leading the Party and has every Republican scared out of their wits to say anything against him, no Republican majority will be happening any time soon.
reply: Agreed. A real Barry Goldwater Republican is not someone I fear not someone anyone should fear. Its a person who knows there is a middle road that we both can agree on. What the GOP today is "make sure we don't do anything to tick off Rush" Barry Goldwater would have told Rush to kiss his backside.
title: Steele to Rush: I'm sorry

content: quote: Originally posted by spanner69: "http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0309/19517.html" quote: Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Steele says he has reached out to Rush Limbaugh to tell him he meant no offense when he referred to the popular conservative radio host as an “entertainer” whose show can be “incendiary.” “My intent was not to go after Rush – I have enormous respect for Rush Limbaugh,” Steele said in a telephone interview. “I was maybe a little bit inarticulate. … There was no attempt on my part to diminish his voice or his leadership.” DADDY Limbaugh took Steele behind the wood shed and spank that "man" silly: DONT (Whack) you ever (Whack) Talk back to me (Whack) again (WHACK!) If you're a Republican dont EVER talk back to Daddy! LMAO I knew it would happen. As I said before, if a guy like Limbaugh is the leader of the GOP, that party is in serious, serious trouble. We all view polls selectively, but the latest poll from Time has his popularity nationwide at about 29 percent ("http://www.timepolls.com/hppolls/archive/poll_results_281.html"). That isn't a good thing... What many people forget is that Limbaugh, like Fox News, enjoys a small lion's share of support. When I say, "small lion's share", what I mean is that they might have the largest single number among a host of competitors/ contemporaries. When you look more closely at those numbers, however, you'll find that, among a certain demographic, Fox and Limbaugh have no competition, and that explains their "success".

If you're a Republican dont EVER talk back to Daddy!
